intro: Phlomoides ariana, commonly known as the Armenian phlomis, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of the Caucasus. It belongs to the family Lamiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and shrubs. The plant typically grows to a height of about 30–60 centimeters, featuring erect stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are usually pink or purple, arranged in dense spikes, and bloom in the summer months. It is often found in rocky or gravelly soils and is adapted to the harsh climatic conditions of its native habitat.
